Plotting base¶

This module contains general functions that serve (or can serve) any/all of the plotting templates.

FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.RGB_to_hex(RGB)[source]¶

Converts RGB color to HEX.

[255,255,255] -> “#FFFFFF”

FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.adjust_subplots(figure, hspace, wspace)[source]¶

Ajudst subplots.

Adjusts subplots according to matplotlib.pyplot.subplots_adjust

Parameters:
figure : matplotlib.pyplot.figure
hspace : float
from matplotlib, the amount of height reserved for space

between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis height

wspace : float
from matplotlib, the amount of width reserved for space

between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis width
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.calc_num_rows(num_subplots, cols_page)[source]¶

Calculates the total number of rows.

Calculates the number of subplot rows to be drawn in the figure based on the total number of subplots to be drawn and the number os columns per page.

Parameters:
num_subplots : int

The total number of subplots

cols_page : int

The desired number os subplot columns per figure’s page.
Returns:
float

The calculated number.
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.calc_real_fig_height(rows_page, numrows, fig_hgt)[source]¶

Calculates real figure height based on the height per page and total number of subplots rows.

Returns:
float

Value in Inches of the final figure height.
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.clean_subplots(axes, num_subplots)[source]¶

Removes unsed subplots from figure.

<axes> length is compared to <num_subplots> and elements in <axes> that have not been used are removed from figure.

Parameters:
axes : matplotlib.axes.Axes
num_subplots : int

The number of subplots that have been draw in the Figure.
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.color_dict(gradient)[source]¶

Takes in a list of RGB sub-lists and returns dictionary of colors in RGB and hex form for use in a graphing function defined later on.

FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.draw_figure(num_subplots, rows_page, cols_page, fig_height, fig_width)[source]¶

Draws the matplotlib figure architecture.

Defines subplot grid distrubitions based on the data to plot, desired rows and columns per page, figure height and width.

Parameters:
num_subplots : int

The total number of subplots

rows_page: :obj:`int`

The desired number os subplot rows per figure’s page.

cols_page : int

The desired number os subplot columns per figure’s page.

fig_height : float

Height of the figure’s page.

fig_width : float

Width of the figure’s page.
Returns:
tuple

(Figure, Axes) matplotlib.pyplot.figure and matplotlib.pyplot.axes objects.
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.hex_to_RGB(hexx)[source]¶

Converts HEX color to RGB.

“#FFFFFF” -> [255,255,255]

FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.linear_gradient(start_hex, finish_hex='#FFFFFF', n=10)[source]¶

Returns a gradient list of (n) colors between two hex colors. start_hex and finish_hex should be the full six-digit color string, inlcuding the number sign (“#FFFFFF”)

Parameters:
start_hex : str

The starting HEX color color.

finish_hex : str

The ending HEX color color. Defaults to #FFFFFF.

n : int

The number of steps. Defaults to 10.
FarseerNMR.plot.base.plottingbase.save_figure(figure, file_path, header='', header_fs=5, dpi=300)[source]¶

Saves figure to path.

Parameters:
figure : matplotlib.pyplot.figure
file_path : str

File name path of the output file.

For example: /home/user/where/ever/i/want/figure.pdf

file extensions can be such as accepted by fname in:

https://matplotlib.org/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.savefig.html

header : str

Multi-line string with additional human-readable notes. Header will be written in the output figure file in a dedicated blank space.

header_fs : int

The header fontsize.

dpi : int

The resolution in dots per inch.

The Figure resolution in dpi. Deppends on the file extension.

Additional help: https://matplotlib.org/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.savefig.html
